name: Salty Dog
description: The Salty Dog is a Greyhound cocktail with salt — hence the name. Craig Claiborne first brought the recipe to The Times in 1968 for a Fourth of July barbecue feature. While his version calls for adding salt to the drink, other recipes salt the rim of the glass instead; see the variation below.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a highball glass with ice, and then add the grapefruit juice through a small strainer to remove pulp.
Add salt and vodka and stir until well chilled. Serve.
